questions.question: 1. The water content of a soil sample cannot be determined by ____ method.

explanations.a: This method can be used as is demonstrated by this very experiment.
explanations.b: This method is very similar to the oven drying method. Instead of using an oven to dry the soil, the sample is mixed with a methylated spirit and heated with constant stirring. Clearly, this method can be used for water content determination.
explanations.c: This method can be used for water content determination. To know more about this method, click here.
explanations.d: The pipette method is the standard sedimentation method used in laboratory for wet mechanical or sedimentation analysis.

questions.question: 2. In the oven drying method, the soil sample is kept for about ____ hours in the oven.

explanations.d: For complete drying, sandy soil takes about 4 hours and fat clays take about 14 to 16 hours. To assure complete drying of the sample, it is kept for about 24 hours.
